If a frightened target ends its turn more than 30 feet away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Smite
bonus_actions.desc: Immediately after the blackguard hits a target with an attack roll, the blackguard can force that target to make a 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers one of the following effects of the blackguard's choice:

bonus_actions.name: Blind
bonus_actions.desc: The target is blinded for 1 minute. The blinded target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Shove
bonus_actions.desc: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

spells: The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

monsters.name: Blue Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes three Bite or Lightning Strike attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Strike
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 36 (8d8) lightning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Teleport
bonus_actions.desc: The abishai teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

spells: The abishai casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.At will: disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion

spells.2/day each: charm person, dispel magic, greater invisibility, wall of force

monsters.name: Bodak
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Abyssal, the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Death Gaze
traits.desc:
When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a 13 Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save.
Unless {@status surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.desc: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The bodak doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Withering Gaze
actions.desc: One creature that the bodak can see within 60 feet of it must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Aura of Annihilation
bonus_actions.desc: The bodak activates or deactivates this deathly aura. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and Fiends ignore this effect.

actions.name: Pummel
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Oil Puddle
actions.desc: The boggle creates a puddle of nonflammable oil. The puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain for all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour. The oil has one of the following additional effects of the boggle's choice:

actions.name: Slippery Oil
actions.desc: Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

actions.name: Sticky Oil
actions.desc: Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained. On its turn, a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself, ending the effect and moving into the nearest unoccupied space of its choice with a successful 11 Strength check.

bonus_actions.name: Boggle Oil
bonus_actions.desc: The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores, giving itself one of the following benefits of its choice until it uses this bonus action again:

bonus_actions.name: Slippery Oil
bonus_actions.desc: The boggle has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds and end grapples, and it can move through openings large enough for a Tiny creature without squeezing.

bonus_actions.name: Sticky Oil
bonus_actions.desc: The boggle has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. The boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

bonus_actions.name: Dimensional Rift
bonus_actions.desc: The boggle creates an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame it can see within 5 feet of it, provided that the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. The dimensional rift bridges the distance between that space and a point within 30 feet of it that the boggle can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). While next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. Only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.

monsters.name: Boneclaw
monsters.languages: Common plus one language spoken by its master

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: While its master lives, a destroyed boneclaw gains a new body in 1d10 hours, with all its hit points. The new body appears within 1 mile of the boneclaw's master.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The boneclaw doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The boneclaw makes two Piercing Claw attacks.

actions.name: Piercing Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, the boneclaw can pull the target up to 10 feet toward itself, and the target is grappled (escape 14). The boneclaw has two claws. While a claw grapples a target, the claw can attack only that target.

actions.name: Shadow Jump (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
If the boneclaw is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the boneclaw's choice within 15 feet of it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or take 34 (5d12 + 2) necrotic damage.
The boneclaw then teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Stealth
bonus_actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the boneclaw takes the {@action Hide} action.

reactions.name: Deadly Reach
reactions.desc: In response to a creature entering a space within 15 feet of it, the boneclaw makes one Piercing Claw attack against that creature.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

traits.name: Rotting Presence
traits.desc: When any creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of the bulezau, that creature must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The bulezau's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Sure-Footed
traits.desc: The bulezau has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

actions.name: Barbed Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned until the disease ends. While poisoned in this way, the target sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin, and the target must repeat the saving throw after every 24 hours that elapse. On a successful save, the disease ends. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 4 (1d8). The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

monsters.name: Cadaver Collector
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The collector makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Specters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; 1d4 specter (without Sunlight Sensitivity) arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. The specters act right after the collector on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the collector is destroyed.

monsters.name: Canoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Dimensional Lock
traits.desc: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within 60 feet of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Uncanny Senses
traits.desc: The canoloth can't be {@status surprised} unless it's incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The canoloth makes one Bite or Tongue attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 15), pulled up to 30 feet toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

traits.name: Stench
traits.desc: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within 10 feet of the catoblepas must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

actions.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

traits.name: Flammable Blood
traits.desc: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Retract Filament
actions.desc: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

bonus_actions.name: Adhesive Filament
bonus_actions.desc: The cave fisher extends a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature the filament adheres to is grappled by the cave fisher (escape 13), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful 13 Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher. The filament crumbles away if the cave fisher takes this bonus action again.

traits.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
traits.desc: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The champion makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

bonus_actions.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The champion regains 20 hit points.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The chitine has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the chitine to sleep.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The chitine ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chitine makes three Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

traits.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

traits.name: Boneless
traits.desc: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The choker makes two Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

monsters.name: Choldrith

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a 11 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

bonus_actions.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc:
The choldrith conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The choldrith can make a melee spell attack (+4 to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 6 (1d8 + 2) force damage.
The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the choldrith can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.

spells: The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Clockwork Bronze Scout
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Earth Armor
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it burrows.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Flare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: Each creature in contact with the ground within 15 feet of the clockwork must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Clockwork Iron Cobra
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or suffer one random effect (roll a d6):

actions.name: 1–2: Confusion
actions.desc: On its next turn, the target must use its action to make one weapon attack against a random creature it can see within 30 feet of it, using whatever weapon it has in hand and moving beforehand if necessary to get in range. If it's holding no weapon, it makes an unarmed strike. If no creature is visible within 30 feet, it takes the {@action Dash} action, moving toward the nearest creature.

actions.name: 3–4: Paralysis
actions.desc: The target is paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: 5–6: Poison
actions.desc: The target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage.

monsters.name: Clockwork Oaken Bolter
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The clockwork makes two Lancing Bolt attacks or one Lancing Bolt attack and one Harpoon attack.

actions.name: Lancing Bolt
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 100/400 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Harpoon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 12). While grappled in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the clockwork. A creature takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The clockwork can grapple only one creature at a time with its harpoon.

actions.name: Explosive Bolt (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The clockwork launches an explosive charge at a point within 120 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Reel In
bonus_actions.desc: The clockwork pulls the creature grappled by its Harpoon up to 20 feet closer.

monsters.name: Clockwork Stone Defender
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

reactions.name: Intercept Attack
reactions.desc: In response to another creature within 5 feet of it being hit by an attack roll, the clockwork gives that creature a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack, potentially causing a miss. To use this ability, the clockwork must be able to see the creature and the attacker.

monsters.name: Cloud Giant Smiling One

traits.name: Control Weather (8th-level Spell)
traits.desc: The giant can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Slam attacks or two Telekinetic Strike attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Strike
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 240 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The giant magically transforms to look and feel like a Beast or a Humanoid it has seen or to return to its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, don't change. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Cloud Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion

monsters.name: Conjurer Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The conjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

bonus_actions.name: Benign Transportation (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The conjurer teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see. If it instead chooses a space within range that is occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature, they both teleport, swapping places.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Elemental (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The conjurer magically summons an air elemental, an earth elemental, a fire elemental, or a water elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the conjurer, whom it obeys. It takes its turn immediately after the conjurer. It lasts for 1 hour, until it or the conjurer dies, or until the conjurer dismisses it as a bonus action.

spells: The conjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

monsters.name: Corpse Flower
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Corpses
traits.desc: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Stench of Death
traits.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The corpse flower makes three Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Harvest the Dead
actions.desc: The corpse flower swallows one unsecured Humanoid corpse within 10 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

bonus_actions.name: Digest
bonus_actions.desc: The corpse flower digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 (2d10) hit points. Nothing of the digested corpse remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the corpse flower in its space.

bonus_actions.name: Reanimate
bonus_actions.desc: The corpse flower animates one corpse in its body, turning it into a zombie. The zombie appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse flower and acts immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombie acts as an ally of the corpse flower but isn't under its control, and the flower's stench clings to it (see Stench of Death).

traits.name: Telepathic Shroud
traits.desc: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Illumination
bonus_actions.desc: The cranium rat sheds dim light from its exposed brain in a 5-foot radius or extinguishes the light.

monsters.name: Darkling
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Death Flash
traits.desc: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Darkling Elder
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 16

traits.name: Death Burn
traits.desc: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The darkling elder makes two Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

spells: The darkling elder casts darkness, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

traits.name: Lightning Blood
traits.desc: A creature within 5 feet of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The death kiss makes three Tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain—one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

monsters.name: Deathlock
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand

spells.1/day each: dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb

monsters.name: Deathlock Mastermind
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the deathlock's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Deathly Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (3d6 + 3 necrotic damage).

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion

spells.1/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility

monsters.name: Deathlock Wight
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the deathlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deathlock makes two Life Drain or Grave Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d8 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.
A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the deathlock's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The deathlock can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Grave Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

spells: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor

monsters.name: Deep Rothé

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The rothé is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the rothé moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

spells: The rothé casts dancing lights, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

monsters.name: Deep Scion
monsters.speed: 30 ft. (20 ft. and swim 40 ft. in hybrid form)

traits.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deep scion makes two Battleaxe attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within 300 feet. Creatures within 30 feet of the deep scion must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The deep scion transforms into a hybrid form (humanoid-piscine) or back into its true form, which is humanlike. Its statistics, other than its speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. The deep scion reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the deinonychus moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Demogorgon
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Demogorgon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.desc: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Demogorgon makes two Tentacle attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Gaze.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 23 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Gaze
actions.desc: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 1–2: Beguiling Gaze
actions.desc: The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight.

actions.name: 3–4: Confusing Gaze
actions.desc: The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.

actions.name: 5–6: Hypnotic Gaze
actions.desc: The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its action, reaction, and movement.

legendary_actions.name: Gaze
legendary_actions.desc: Demogorgon uses Gaze and must use either Beguiling Gaze or Confusing Gaze.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Demogorgon uses Spellcasting.

spells: Demogorgon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Hooked Spear
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the derro can choose to deal no damage and knock it prone.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Derro Savant

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Beam
actions.desc: The derro launches a brilliant beam of magical energy in a 5-foot-wide line that is 60 feet long. Each creature in the line must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The derro casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Imprison Soul
actions.desc: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a 20-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It can speak and cast spells while in spider form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying in Humanoid form melds into the spider form. It can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. It reverts to its Humanoid form if it dies.
