bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The duergar makes three Psychic-Attuned Hammer or Javelin attacks and uses Call to Attack.

actions.name: Psychic-Attuned Hammer
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge.

actions.name: Call to Attack
actions.desc: Up to three allies within 120 feet of this duergar that can hear it can each use their reaction to make one weapon attack.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

reactions.name: Scouring Instruction
reactions.desc: When an ally that the duergar can see makes a d20 roll, the duergar can roll a d6, and the ally can add the number rolled to the d20 by taking 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.desc: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against spells and the charmed, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Fire Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage, or 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage while under the effect of Enlarge, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Spray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: From its fire lance, the duergar shoots a 15-foot cone of fire or a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The duergar magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour or until it attacks, it forces a creature to make a saving throw, or its {@status concentration} is broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

monsters.name: Dybbuk
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The dybbuk can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The dybbuk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is also reduced by 3 (1d6). This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Possess Corpse (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The dybbuk disappears into an intact corpse within 5 feet of it that belonged to a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid. The dybbuk gains 20 temporary hit points. While possessing the corpse, the dybbuk adopts the corpse's size and can't use Incorporeal Movement. Its game statistics otherwise remain the same. The possession lasts until the temporary hit points are lost or the dybbuk ends it as a bonus action. When the possession ends, the dybbuk appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the corpse.

bonus_actions.name: Control Corpse
bonus_actions.desc: While Possess Corpse is active, the dybbuk makes the corpse do something unnatural, such as vomit blood, twist its head all the way around, or cause a quadruped to move as a biped. Any Beast or Humanoid that sees this behavior must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dybbuk for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this ability is immune to Control Corpse for 24 hours.

spells: The dybbuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Earth Elemental Myrmidon
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Terran, one language of its creator's choice

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes two Maul attacks.

actions.name: Maul
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Thunderous Strike (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes one Maul attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 22 (4d10) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Eidolon
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object other than a sacred statue.

traits.name: Sacred Animation (Recharge 5-6)
traits.desc: When the eidolon moves into a space occupied by a sacred statue in place of its own.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The eidolon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Divine Dread
actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the eidolon that can see it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the eidolon by the safest available route at the start of each of its turns, unless there is nowhere for it to move, in which case the creature also becomes stunned until it can move again. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any eidolon's Divine Dread for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Elder Brain
monsters.languages: understands Common, Deep Speech, and Undercommon but can't speak, telepathy 5 miles

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The elder brain is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Telepathic Hub
traits.desc: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 20 (4d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 15) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a 18 Intelligence saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Link
bonus_actions.desc: The elder brain targets one incapacitated creature it senses with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. Until the link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer incapacitated, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful 18 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage. The link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

bonus_actions.name: Sense Thoughts
bonus_actions.desc: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's emotional state and foremost thoughts (including worries, loves, and hates).

legendary_actions.name: Break Concentration
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's {@status concentration} on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 2 (1d4) psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Pulse
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The target and enemies of the elder brain within 30 feet of target take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Sever Psychic Link
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The elder brain makes one Tentacle attack.

spells: The elder brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

monsters.name: Elder Oblex
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this distance), passive Perception 15

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The elder oblex makes two Pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Eat Memories
actions.desc:
The oblex targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 18 Wisdom saving throw or take 44 (8d10) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.
While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends.
The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

bonus_actions.name: Sulfurous Impersonation
bonus_actions.desc: The oblex extrudes a piece of itself that assumes the appearance of one Medium or smaller creature whose memories it has stolen. This simulacrum appears, feels, and sounds exactly like the creature it impersonates, though it smells faintly of sulfur. The oblex can impersonate 2d6 + 1 different creatures, each one tethered to its body by a strand of slime that can extend up to 120 feet away. The simulacrum is an extension of the oblex, meaning that the oblex occupies its space and the simulacrum's space simultaneously. The tether is immune to damage, but it is severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the oblex and the simulacrum. The simulacrum disappears if the tether is severed.

spells: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.3/day each: dimension door, dominate person, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

monsters.name: Elder Tempest
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Air Form
traits.desc: The tempest can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The tempest doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Living Storm
traits.desc: The tempest is always at the center of a storm 1d6 + 4 miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. They also extinguish open flames and disperse fog.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The tempest deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tempest makes two Thunderous Slam attacks.

actions.name: Thunderous Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 23 (4d6 + 9) thunder damage.

actions.name: Lightning Storm (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Each creature within 120 feet of the tempest must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also stunned until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Lightning Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest can cause a bolt of lightning to strike a point on the ground anywhere under its storm. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Screaming Gale (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The tempest releases a blast of thunder and wind in a line that is 300 feet long and 20 feet wide. Objects in that area take 22 (4d10) thunder damage. Each creature there must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) thunder damage and be flung up to 60 feet in a direction away from the line. If a thrown target collides with an immovable object (such as a wall or floor) or another creature, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown before impact. If the target collides with another creature, that other creature must succeed on a 19 Dexterity saving throw or take the same impact damage and be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Enchanter Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The enchanter makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage.

reactions.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharge 4-6)
reactions.desc: When a visible creature within 30 feet of the enchanter makes an attack roll against it, the enchanter forces the attacker to make a 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker redirects the attack roll to the creature closest to it, other than the enchanter or itself. If multiple eligible creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

spells: The enchanter casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.2/day each: charm person, mage armor, hold person, invisibility, suggestion, tongues

monsters.name: Evoker Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The evoker makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Sculpted Explosion (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The evoker unleashes a magical explosion of a particular damage type: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The magic erupts in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 150 feet of the evoker. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw. The evoker can select up to three creatures it can see in the area to ignore the spell, as the evoker sculpts the spell's energy around them. On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) damage of the chosen type and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

spells: The evoker casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: ice storm, lightning bolt, mage armor

traits.name: Extraordinary Leap
traits.desc: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to move 3 feet.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Sticky Leg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape 12). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

monsters.name: Fire Elemental Myrmidon
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: Ignan, one language of its creator's choice

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The myrmidon sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light in a 40-foot radius.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility
traits.desc: For every 5 feet the myrmidon moves in 1 foot or more of water, it takes 2 (1d4) cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The myrmidon makes three Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Fiery Strikes (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Dual Shields
traits.desc: The giant carries two shields, which together give the giant +3 to its AC (accounted for above).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Fireshield or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Fireshield
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shield Charge (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The giant moves up to 30 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or take 36 (8d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage and be pushed up to 30 feet and knocked prone.

monsters.name: Firenewt Warlock of Imix

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the firenewt's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Imix's Blessing
traits.desc: When the firenewt reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the firenewt gains 5 temporary hit points.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firenewt makes three Morningstar or Fire Ray attacks.

actions.name: Morningstar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) fire damage.

spells: The firenewt casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.At will: guidance, light, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The firenewt makes two Scimitar attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spit Fire (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The firenewt spits fire at a creature within 10 feet of it. The creature must make a 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Flail Snail
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Antimagic Shell
traits.desc:
The snail has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature making a spell attack against the snail has disadvantage on the attack roll.
If the snail succeeds on its saving throw against a spell or a spell's attack roll misses it, the snail's shell converts some of the spell's energy into a burst of destructive force if the spell is of 1st level or higher; each creature within 30 feet of the snail must make a 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) force damage per level of the spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The snail makes five Flail Tentacle attacks.

actions.name: Flail Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Shell (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc: The snail's shell emits dazzling, colored light until the end of the snail's next turn. During this time, the shell sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet, and creatures that can see the snail have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, any creature within the bright light and able to see the snail when this power is activated must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the light ends.

actions.name: Shell Defense
actions.desc: The flail snail withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to its AC and is restrained. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

traits.name: Aura of Blood Thirst
traits.desc: If the flind isn't incapacitated, any creature with the Rampage trait can make a Bite attack as a bonus action while within 10 feet of the flind.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The flind makes one Flail of Chaos attack, one Flail of Pain attack, and one Flail of Paralysis attack, or it makes three Longbow attacks.

actions.name: Flail of Chaos
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target must use its reaction, if available, to make one melee attack against a random creature, other than the flind, within its reach. If there's no creature within reach, the target instead moves half its speed in a random direction.

actions.name: Flail of Pain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Flail of Paralysis
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Fraz-Urb'luu
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Fraz-Urb'luu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Fraz-Urb'luu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Undetectable
traits.desc: Fraz-Urb'luu can't be targeted by divination magic, perceived through magical scrying sensors, or detected by abilities that sense demons or Fiends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Fraz-Urb'luu makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks, and he uses Phantasmal Terror.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (3d6 + 9) force damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d8 + 9) force damage.

actions.name: Phantasmal Terror
actions.desc: Fraz-Urb'luu targets one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw, or it takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage and is frightened of Fraz-Urb'luu until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d10 + 9) force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is also grappled (escape 24), and it is restrained until the grapple ends. Fraz-Urb'luu can grapple only one creature with his tail at a time.

legendary_actions.name: Terror (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Fraz-Urb'luu uses Phantasmal Terror.

spells: Fraz-Urb'luu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, dispel magic, phantasmal force

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shock Susceptibility
traits.desc: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The froghemoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks, and it can use Tongue.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.
The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 16) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.desc: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must make a 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the froghemoth.

traits.name: Extra Heads
traits.desc: The giant has a {@chance 25} chance of having more than one head. If it has more than one, it has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two Greataxe or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 26 (3d12 + 7) slashing damage, or 30 (3d12 + 11) slashing damage while raging.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Vaprak's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The giant enters a rage. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is incapacitated. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:

bonus_actions.name: The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

monsters.name: Frost Salamander
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Burning Fury
traits.desc:
When the salamander takes fire damage, its
Freezing Breath automatically recharges.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The salamander makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The salamander exhales chill wind in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Stunning Gaze
traits.desc:
When a creature that can see the gauth's central eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a 14 Wisdom saving throw if the gauth isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is stunned until the start of its next turn.
Unless {@status surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it can't see the gauth until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: Death Throes
traits.desc: When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The gauth shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (roll three d6s, and reroll duplicates), targeting one to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1: Devour Magic Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or have one of its magic items lose all magical properties until the start of the gauth's next turn. If the object is a charged item, it also loses 1d4 charges. Determine the affected item randomly, ignoring single-use items such as potions and scrolls.

actions.name: 2: Enervation Ray
actions.desc: The target must make a 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 3: Fire Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

actions.name: 4: Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5: Pushing Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.

actions.name: 6: Sleep Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (roll two d4s, and reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within 60 feet of it:

actions.name: 1: Dazing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: 2: Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.

actions.name: 3: Frost Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

actions.name: 4: Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc: If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is a Tiny object that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

bonus_actions.name: Aggressive
bonus_actions.desc: The gazer moves up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

monsters.name: Geryon
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Geryon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Geryon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Geryon regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Geryon dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Geryon makes one Claw attack and one Stinger attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 23 (4d6 + 9) cold damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (24), and it is restrained until the grapple ends. Geryon can grapple one creature at a time. If the target is already grappled by Geryon, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) cold damage.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. 14 (2d4 + 9) force damage, and the target must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or take 13 (2d12) poison damage and become poisoned until it finishes a short or long rest. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the poison damage taken. This reduction lasts until the poisoned condition is removed. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Geryon teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary_actions.name: Infernal Glare
legendary_actions.desc: Geryon targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 23 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of Geryon until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Geryon uses Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Swift Sting (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Geryon makes one Stinger attack.

spells: Geryon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 21):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, ice storm, invisibility (self only), locate object, suggestion, wall of ice

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the giant strider is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fire Burst (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The giant strider hurls a gout of flame at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners, and it ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried

traits.name: Firearms Knowledge
traits.desc: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of muskets and pistols.

traits.name: Headfirst Charge
traits.desc: The giff can try to knock a creature over; if the giff moves at least 20 feet in a straight line and ends within 5 feet of a Large or smaller creature, that creature must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or take 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giff makes two Longsword, Musket, or Pistol attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Musket
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Pistol
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fragmentation Grenade (1/Day)
actions.desc: The giff throws a grenade up to 60 feet, and the grenade explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The girallon makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Aggressive
bonus_actions.desc: The girallon moves up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

monsters.name: Githyanki Gish

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githyanki makes three Longsword or Telekinetic Bolt attacks, or it makes one of those attacks and uses Spellcasting.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 28 (8d6) force damage.

bonus_actions.name: Astral Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The githyanki teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.At will: light, mage hand (the hand is invisible), message

monsters.name: Githyanki Kith'rak

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githyanki makes three Greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 17 (5d6) psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Astral Step (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The githyanki teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

bonus_actions.name: Rally the Troops
bonus_actions.desc: The githyanki magically ends the charmed and frightened conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The githyanki adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the githyanki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spells: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

monsters.name: Githyanki Supreme Commander

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the githyanki fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githyanki makes two Silver Greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Silver Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 17 (5d6) psychic damage. On a critical hit against a target in an astral body (as with the astral projection spell), the githyanki can cut the silvery cord that tethers the target to its material body, instead of dealing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Astral Step
bonus_actions.desc: The githyanki teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.desc: The githyanki adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the githyanki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary_actions.name: Command Ally
legendary_actions.desc: The githyanki targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the githyanki, the target can make one melee weapon attack using its reaction, if available, and has advantage on the attack roll.

legendary_actions.name: Attack (2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The githyanki makes one Silver Greatsword attack.

spells: The githyanki casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.1/day each: Bigby's hand, mass suggestion, plane shift, telekinesis

monsters.name: Githzerai Anarch

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the githzerai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Psychic Defense
traits.desc: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Strike
legendary_actions.desc: The githzerai makes one Unarmed Strike attack.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: The githzerai teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Change Gravity (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The githzerai casts the reverse gravity spell, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. The spell has the normal effect, except that the githzerai can orient the area in any direction and creatures and objects fall toward the end of the area.

spells: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.1/day each: globe of invulnerability, plane shift, wall of force

monsters.name: Githzerai Enlightened

traits.name: Psychic Defense
traits.desc: While the githzerai is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The githzerai makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: Temporal Strike (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 52 (8d12) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it's occupied.

reactions.name: Slow Fall
reactions.desc: When the githzerai falls, it reduces any falling damage it takes by 50.

spells: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sudden Rush
actions.desc: Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by 60 feet and it doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

bonus_actions.name: Rampage
bonus_actions.desc: After the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll moves up to half its speed and makes a Bite attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The gnoll makes two Bite, Spear, or Longbow attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Rampage
bonus_actions.desc: After the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll moves up to half its speed and makes a Bite attack.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The witherling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spiked Club

bonus_actions.desc: After the witherling reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll moves up to half its speed and makes one Bite attack.

reactions.desc: In response to a gnoll being reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of the witherling, the witherling makes one Bite or Spiked Club attack.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the target must succeed on a 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, plus 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage if the target is prone.

reactions.name: Bloody Rampage
reactions.desc: When the gray render takes damage, it makes one Claw attack against a random creature within its reach, other than its master.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Graz'zt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Graz'zt has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.desc: Graz'zt makes two Wave of Sorrow attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 20 (4d6 + 6) force damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage.

bonus_actions.desc: Graz'zt transforms into a form that resembles a Medium Humanoid or back into his true form. Aside from his size, his statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

reactions.name: Negate Spell (Recharge 5-6)
reactions.desc: Graz'zt tries to interrupt a spell he sees a creature casting within 60 feet of him. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, Graz'zt makes a Charisma check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

legendary_actions.name: Abyssal Magic
legendary_actions.desc: Graz'zt uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Attack

legendary_actions.name: Dance, My Puppet!
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by Graz'zt that Graz'zt can see must use its reaction to move up to its speed as Graz'zt directs.

spells.At will: charm person, detect magic, dispel magic

traits.desc: If the grung isn't immersed in water for at least 1 hour during a day, it suffers 1 level of exhaustion at the end of that day. The grung can recover from this exhaustion only through magic or by immersing itself in water for at least 1 hour.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

spells: The grung casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The guard drake makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Hellfire Engine
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The hellfire engine is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hellfire engine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The hellfire engine doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Flesh-Crushing Stride
actions.desc:
The hellfire engine moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the hellfire engine enters must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the nearest space out of the hellfire engine's path. On a failed save, the creature falls prone and takes 28 (8d6) bludgeoning damage.
If the hellfire engine remains in the prone creature's space, the creature is also restrained until it's no longer in the same space as the hellfire engine. While restrained in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a 18 Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the hellfire engine and is no longer restrained.

actions.name: Hellfire Weapons
actions.desc: The hellfire engine uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 1–2: Bonemelt Sprayer
actions.desc: The hellfire engine spews acidic flame in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) fire damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the saving throw are drenched in burning acid and take 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage at the end of their turns. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to scrape off the burning fuel.

actions.name: 3–4: Lightning Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) lightning damage. Up to three other creatures of the hellfire engine's choice that it can see within 30 feet of the target must each make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 5–6: Thunder Cannon
actions.desc:
The hellfire engine targets a point within 120 feet of it that it can see. Each creature within 30 feet of that point must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If the chosen option kills a creature, the creature's soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Devastator

traits.name: Army Arcana
traits.desc: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hobgoblin makes two Quarterstaff or Devastating Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Quarterstaff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) force damage.

actions.name: Devastating Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 21 (4d8 + 3) force damage, and the target is knocked prone.

spells: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.2/day each: fireball, fly, fog cloud, gust of wind, lightning bolt

monsters.name: Hobgoblin Iron Shadow

traits.name: Unarmored Defense
traits.desc: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc:
The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an Unarmed Strike or a Dart attack. It can also use
Shadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Dart
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shadow Jaunt
actions.desc: The hobgoblin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it leaves and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

spells: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

spells.1/day each: charm person, disguise self, silent image

monsters.name: Howler
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: A howler has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the howler's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The howler makes two Rending Bite attacks.

actions.name: Rending Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage if the target is frightened. This attack ignores damage resistance.

actions.name: Mind-Breaking Howl (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The howler emits a keening howl in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 16 (3d10) psychic damage and be frightened until the end of the howler's next turn. While a creature is frightened in this way, its speed is halved, and it is incapacitated. A target that successfully saves is immune to the Mind-Breaking Howl of all howlers for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Hungry Sorrowsworn
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Life Hunger
traits.desc: If a creature within 60 feet of the sorrowsworn regains hit points, the sorrowsworn gains two benefits until the end of its next turn: it has advantage on attack rolls, and its Bite deals an extra 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sorrowsworn makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape 16), and it is restrained until the grapple ends. While grappling a creature, the sorrowsworn can't make a Claw attack.

monsters.name: Hutijin
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Infernal Despair
traits.desc: Each creature within 30 feet of Hutijin that isn't a devil makes saving throws with disadvantage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Hutijin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Hutijin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Hutijin regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Hutijin dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Hutijin makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, one Mace attack, and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage. The target must succeed on a 22 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) cold damage.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) force damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d10 + 8) thunder damage.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Hutijin teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

reactions.name: Fearful Voice (Recharge 5-6)
reactions.desc: In response to taking damage, Hutijin utters a dreadful word of power. Each creature within 30 feet of him that isn't a devil must succeed on a 22 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of him for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect is immune to his Fearful Voice for 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Hutijin makes one Claw, Mace, or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Hutijin uses Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Hutijin releases lightning in a 30-foot radius, blocked only by total cover. All other creatures in that area must each make a 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: Hutijin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 22):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only), lightning bolt, suggestion, wall of fire

monsters.name: Hydroloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hydroloth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The hydroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Secure Memory
traits.desc: The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx, as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

traits.name: Watery Advantage
traits.desc: While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has advantage on attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The hydroloth makes two Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.  14 (2d8 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

actions.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
actions.desc: The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a 16 Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies; it can't cast spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The hydroloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The hydroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only)

spells.3/day each: control water, crown of madness, fear, suggestion

monsters.name: Illusionist Wizard

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The illusionist makes two Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Displacement (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The illusionist projects an illusion that makes the illusionist appear to be standing in a place a few inches from its actual location, causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against the illusionist. The effect lasts for 1 minute, and it ends early if the illusionist takes damage, if it is incapacitated, or if its speed becomes 0.

spells: The illusionist casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion

spells.2/day each: disguise self, invisibility, mage armor, major image, phantasmal force, phantom steed

monsters.name: Juiblex
monsters.damage_immunities: acid, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, unconscious

traits.name: Foul
traits.desc: Any creature other than an Ooze that starts its turn within 10 feet of Juiblex must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Juiblex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Juiblex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Juiblex regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Juiblex dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: Juiblex can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Juiblex makes three Acid Lash attacks.

actions.name: Acid Lash
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. 21 (4d6 + 7) acid damage. Any creature killed by this attack is drawn into Juiblex's body, where the corpse is dissolved after 1 minute.

actions.name: Eject Slime (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Juiblex spews out a corrosive slime, targeting one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) acid damage. Unless the target avoids taking all of this damage, any metal armor worn by the target takes a permanent −1 penalty to the AC it offers, and any metal weapon the target is carrying or wearing takes a permanent −1 penalty to damage rolls. The penalty worsens each time a target is subjected to this effect. If the penalty on an object drops to −5, the object is destroyed. The penalty on an object can be removed by the mending spell.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Juiblex makes one Acid Lash attack.

legendary_actions.name: Corrupting Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 21 (4d6 + 7) poison damage, and the target is slimed. Until the slime is scraped off with an action, the target is poisoned, and any creature, other than an Ooze, is poisoned while within 10 feet of the target.

spells: Juiblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

monsters.name: Ki-rin
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 19

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ki-rin makes two Hoof attacks and one Horn attack, or it makes two Sacred Fire attacks.

actions.name: Hoof
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 10 (2d4 + 5) force damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) radiant damage.

actions.name: Sacred Fire
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) radiant damage.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin moves up to half its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary_actions.name: Smite
legendary_actions.desc: The ki-rin makes one Hoof, Horn, or Sacred Fire attack.

spells: The ki-rin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

spells.3/day each: cure wounds, dispel magic, lesser restoration, sending

spells.1/day each: banishment, calm emotions, create food and water, greater restoration, plane shift, protection from evil and good, revivify, wind walk

traits.name: Dragon's Resistance
traits.desc: The kobold has resistance to a type of damage based on the color of dragon that invested it with power (choose or roll a d10): 1–2, acid (black or copper); 3–4, cold (silver or white); 5–6, fire (brass, gold, or red); 7–8, lightning (blue or bronze); 9–10, poison (green).

traits.name: Heart of the Dragon
traits.desc: If the kobold is frightened or paralyzed by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within 30 feet of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kobold makes two Spear attacks.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sling
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Weapon Invention
actions.desc: The kobold uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d8); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day:

actions.name: 1: Acid
actions.desc: The kobold hurls a acid (vial)) acid damage.

actions.name: 2: Alchemist's Fire
actions.desc: The kobold throws a Alchemist's Fire (flask) Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

actions.name: 3: Basket of Centipedes
actions.desc: The kobold throws a small basket into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A Swarm of Centipedes chance that the swarm disperses.

actions.name: 4: Green Slime Pot
actions.desc: The kobold throws a clay pot full of green slime at the target, and it breaks open on impact. Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 5/20 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) acid damage, and the target is covered in slime until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the slime off. A target covered in the slime takes 5 (1d10) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: 5: Rot Grub Pot
actions.desc: The kobold throws a clay pot into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it, and it breaks open on impact. A swarm of rot grubs (in this book) emerges from the shattered pot and remains a hazard in that square.

actions.name: 6: Scorpion on a Stick
actions.desc: The kobold makes a melee attack with a scorpion tied to the end of a 5-foot-long pole. Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: 7: Skunk in a Cage
actions.desc: The kobold releases a skunk into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The skunk has a walking speed of 20 feet, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks. It rolls initiative and, on its turn, uses its action to spray musk at a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 9 Constitution saving throw, or it retches and is incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that doesn't need to breathe or is immune to poison automatically succeeds on the saving throw. Once the skunk has sprayed its musk, it can't do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.

actions.name: 8: Wasp Nest in a Bag
actions.desc: The kobold throws a small bag into a 5-foot-square space within 20 feet of it. A Swarm of Wasps chance that the swarm disperses.

monsters.name: Kobold Scale Sorcerer

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The kobold makes two Dagger or Chromatic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Chromatic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +4 to hit, range 60 feet, one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) of a type of the kobold's choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

spells: The kobold casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Korred
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 120 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The korred makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

bonus_actions.name: Command Hair
bonus_actions.desc:
The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. The korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated.
A rope of korred hair has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korred's turns while the rope has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

spells: The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):
