actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes one Constrict attack and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The yuan-ti can constrict only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spectral Fangs
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature.
The target must make a 13 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If it dies, it stays in its current form.

spells: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: animal friendship (snakes only), mage hand, message, prestidigitation

monsters.name: Yuan-ti Pit Master

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The yuan-ti makes three Bite attacks or two Spectral Fangs attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Spectral Fangs
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 16 (3d8 + 3) poison damage.

actions.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
actions.desc: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The yuan-ti transforms into a Medium snake or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

spells: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: animal friendship (snakes only), guidance, mage hand, message

monsters.name: Zaratan
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 15

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Bite attack and one Stomp attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +17 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 26 (3d10 + 10) thunder damage.

actions.name: Spit Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +17 to hit, range 120 ft./240 ft., one target. 31 (6d8 + 10) force damage.

actions.name: Spew Debris (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a 90-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
bonus_actions.desc: After moving at least 10 feet on the ground, the zaratan sends a shock wave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature on the ground that is {@status concentration||concentrating} must succeed on a 25 Constitution saving throw or the creature's {@status concentration} is broken. The shock wave deals 100 thunder damage to all structures in contact with the ground in the area. If a creature is near a structure that collapses, the creature might be buried; a creature within half the distance of the structure's height must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is restrained, requiring a successful 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become trapped.

legendary_actions.name: Stomp
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Stomp attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Spit (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan makes one Spit Rock attack.

legendary_actions.name: Retract (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan retracts into its shell. Until it takes its Emerge action, it has resistance to all damage, and it is restrained. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Revitalize or Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Revitalize (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell. It regains 52 (5d20) hit points. The next time it takes a legendary action, it must take its Emerge action.

legendary_actions.name: Emerge (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The zaratan emerges from its shell and makes one Spit Rock attack. It can use this option only if it is retracted in its shell.

monsters.name: Zariel
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede Zariel's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Zariel regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Zariel makes three Flail or Longsword attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Horrid Touch, if available.

actions.name: Flail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) radiant damage, or 19 (2d10 + 8) radiant damage when used with two hands, plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Horrid Touch (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Zariel touches one creature within 10 feet of her. The target must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 44 (8d10) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is blinded and deafened. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Zariel uses Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Immolating Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Zariel turns her magical gaze toward one creature she can see within 120 feet of her and commands it to burn. The target must succeed on a 26 Wisdom saving throw or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.

spells: Zariel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 26):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), major image, wall of fire

spells.3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

monsters.name: Zuggtmoy
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Zuggtmoy makes three Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Infestation Spores (3/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a 19 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy, which lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a quaggoth spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be.

bonus_actions.name: Mind Control Spores (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on her, and it lingers for 1 minute. Humanoids and Beasts in the cloud when it appears, or that enter it later, must make a 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, a creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the influence of Zuggtmoy for 24 hours. While infected in this way, the creature is charmed by her and can't be reinfected by these spores.

reactions.name: Protective Thrall
reactions.desc: When Zuggtmoy is hit by an attack roll, one creature within 10 feet of her that is charmed by her is hit by the attack instead.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Zuggtmoy makes one Pseudopod attack.

legendary_actions.name: Exert Will
legendary_actions.desc: One creature charmed by Zuggtmoy that she can see must use its reaction, if a available, to move up to its speed as she directs or to make one weapon attack against a target that she designates.

spells: Zuggtmoy casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 22):

spells.At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants

monsters.name: Razubel

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

actions.name: Force Blast
actions.desc: Each creature in a 20-foot cube originating from the abjurer must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the abjurer. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

reactions.name: Arcane Ward (Recharge 4-6)
reactions.desc: When the abjurer or a creature it can see within 30 feet of it takes damage, the abjurer magically creates a protective barrier around itself or the other creature. The barrier reduces the damage to the protected creature by 26 (4d10 + 4), to a minimum of 0, and then vanishes.

spells: The abjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation

spells.2/day each: dispel magic, lightning bolt, mage armor

spells.1/day each: arcane lock, banishment, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, wall of force

monsters.name: Chest Weasel
monsters.ac: 22 (natural armor while possessing an object), 14 (while not possessing an object)

traits.name: Airtight Seal
traits.desc: The chest weasel doesn’t need to breathe.

traits.name: Cracked Shell
traits.desc: The first time the chest weasel is reduced to 0 hit points, it drops to 1 hit point instead. Until the end of its next turn, all attacks against the chest weasel have disadvantage and its movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The chest weasel can’t use this feature again until it finishes a long rest.

traits.name: False Appearance (while possessing an object)
traits.desc: While the chest weasel remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: New Home
traits.desc: If the chest weasel possesses a new object, it regains half its total HP back.

traits.name: Object Manipulation
traits.desc: While the chest weasel is possessing an object, the object becomes an extension of itself. It can make the object move as fast as the chest weasel can itself move, and it can change characteristics of the object, such as the material from which it’s made of; its weight (with a maximum weight of 100 pounds and a minimum weight of 10); and its size (making it grow or shrink up to twice its original size).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The chest weasel makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Object Possession
actions.desc: The chest weasel possesses a non-magical object that isn’t currently worn or carried by a creature within 5 feet of it.

spells: The chest weasel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks).

spells.3/day each: crown of madness, jump, longstrider, thunderwave, misty step

reactions.name: Misty Step
reactions.desc: The chest weasel can use misty step after another creature takes any action, without consuming the use of a spell.

monsters.name: Adult Amethyst Dragon
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 23

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 20 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 45 (10d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Explosive Crystal (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon spits an amethyst that that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (3d8) force damage and be knocked prone.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.1/day each: blink, control water, dispel magic, protection from evil and good, sending

monsters.name: Adult Crystal Dragon
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Scintillating Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 15 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

actions.desc: The dragon exhales a cloud of spores in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary_actions.name: Commanding Spores
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 16 Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, or the target can't take a reaction, it takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

legendary_actions.desc: The dragon releases poisonous spores around a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. The target must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw or take 17 (5d6) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
actions.desc:
The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within 120 feet of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond 120 feet of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Disorienting Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a wave of psychic dissonance in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 22 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 56 (16d6) psychic damage, and until the end of its next turn, when the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, it must roll a d8 and reduce the total by the number rolled. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Step
bonus_actions.desc: The dragon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet of it.

legendary_actions.name: Claw
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Claw attack.

legendary_actions.name: Psionics (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon uses Psychic Step or Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Emerald Embers (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon creates a dancing mote of green flame around a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 42 (12d6) fire damage.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible), minor illusion

spells.1/day each: detect thoughts, dispel magic, etherealness, major image, mislead

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Tail

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Dream Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales mist in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

actions.name: Moonlight Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a beam of moonlight in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon makes one Tail attack.

spells.2/day each: calm emotions, dispel magic, invisibility, revivify

monsters.name: Ancient Sapphire Dragon
monsters.speed: 40 ft., burrow 40 ft., climb 40 ft., fly 80 ft.
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 28

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The dragon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage.

actions.name: Debilitating Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales a pulse of high-pitched, nearly inaudible sound in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 23 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

legendary_actions.desc: The dragon chooses one Medium or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried that it can see within 60 feet of it, and it magically hurls the object at a creature it can see within 60 feet of the object. The target must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 42 (12d6) bludgeoning damage.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.1/day each: dissonant whispers, hold monster, meld into stone, telekinesis, teleport

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The sea serpent can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the sea serpent fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Constrict
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the sea serpent can't constrict another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 13 (1d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 20 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the sea serpent and knocked prone.

actions.name: Rime Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The sea serpent exhales a 60-foot cone of cold. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 49 (9d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Tail
legendary_actions.desc: The sea serpent makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The sea serpent makes one Bite attack

On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (14d6) necrotic damage and is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

legendary_actions.name: Essential Reduction (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The dragon targets a creature or an object not being worn or carried that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 19 Constitution saving throw or take 40 (9d8) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it crumbles to dust.

spells: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 19):

spells.1/day each: antilife shell, bane, control water, create or destroy water

monsters.name: Animated Breath
monsters.damage_resistances: damage of the type matching the animated breath's form (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison)
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Chromatic Form
traits.desc: When created, the animated breath takes one of five forms, matching its creator's breath weapon: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. This form determines the creature's AC, damage resistance, traits, and attacks.

traits.name: Fire Aura (Fire Form Only)
traits.desc: At the start of each of the animated breath's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Putrid Aura (Acid and Poison Forms Only)
traits.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the animated breath must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A creature that touches the animated breath or hits it with a melee attack takes 3 (1d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The animated breath makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) damage of a type determined by the animated breath's form: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

bonus_actions.name: Lightning Burst (Lightning Form Only)
bonus_actions.desc: The animated breath magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of the animated breath after it teleports takes 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

monsters.name: Aspect of Bahamut
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.
monsters.damage_immunities: acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Platinum Brilliance (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the aspect would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 500 hit points, he recharges his Breath Weapon, and he regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the aspect can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 155,000 XP (310,000 XP total) for defeating the aspect of Bahamut after his Platinum Brilliance activates.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
traits.desc: If the aspect fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The aspect makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 23 (2d12 + 10) piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The aspect can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 23 (2d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 27 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The aspect uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Exalting Breath
actions.desc: The aspect exhales the restoring winds of Mount Celestia in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area of the aspect's choice regains 71 (13d10) hit points, and each creature in that area of the aspect's choice that has been dead for no longer than 1 hour is restored to life with all its hit points.

actions.name: Platinum Breath
actions.desc: The aspect exhales radiant platinum flames in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 (12d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.desc: The aspect magically transforms into any Humanoid or Beast, while retaining his game statistics (other than his size). This transformation ends if the aspect is reduced to 0 hit points or if he uses a bonus action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The aspect makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Furious Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The aspect makes one Bite attack. If the attack hits a creature, the target must succeed on a 27 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the aspect until the end of the target's next turn.

mythic_actions.desc: If the aspect's Platinum Brilliance trait has activated in the last hour, he can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Celestial Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The aspect manifests seven spectral ancient gold dragon around himself that protect him; he gains 77 temporary hit points until the start of his next turn.

mythic_actions.name: Celestial Lances (Costs 3 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The aspect conjures four enormous lances of magical force that plummet to the ground at four different points he can see within 150 feet of him and then disappear. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on each point must succeed on a 27 Dexterity saving throw or take 24 (7d6) force damage. A creature in the area of more than one lance is affected only once.

mythic_actions.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm unleashes a magical roar. Each creature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on the greatwyrm must succeed on a 26 Constitution saving throw or take 19 (3d12) thunder damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

monsters.name: Bronze Greatwyrm
monsters.speed: 60 ft., burrow 60 ft., fly 120 ft., swim 60 ft.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape 20) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:

actions.name: Elemental Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 84 (13d12) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sapping Breath
actions.desc: The greatwyrm exhales gas in a 300-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.desc: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Claw or Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The greatwyrm beats its wings. Each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The greatwyrm can then fly up to half its flying speed.

mythic_actions.desc: If the greatwyrm's Metallic Awakening trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
mythic_actions.desc: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack.

mythic_actions.name: Shattering Roar (Costs 2 Actions)

Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 26 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

mythic_actions.name: Bite
